dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.resource.res.log.soft.Software
dataStructure.description:
This is an abstract base class for representing software. Software represents the set of user visible functions and processes that are contained in a device. The HasSoftwareFeatures association is used to define software that is associated in some way with a LogicalDevice, such as programs and operating systems. Since this software can be associated with devices and/or device components, this association is defined between the roots of the two classes. Software may be nested within other software, thereby creating a containment relationship (which is part of the system view). Currently, the subclasses of this class reflect user-facing features (e.g., features that are manageable, configurable, and executable by users and applications). Internationalization and Language functionality are supported by creating a SoftwareUsesLanguage association to the Language classes.

This entity is abstract

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: Software

child.name: buildNumber
child.description:
This is a string attribute that defines the internal identifier for the compilation of this unit of software.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: buildNumber

child.name: isExperimental
child.description:
This is a Boolean attribute. If the value of this attribute is TRUE, then this represents a special build (perhaps as a trial to suit specific customer needs).

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: isExperimental

child.name: maintenanceVersion
child.description:
This a string attribute that defines the maintenance number component of the version of software being used. For example, if the version of software was 3.1.10, the maintenance version is 10.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: maintenanceVersion

child.name: minorVersion
child.description:
This a string attribute that defines the minor number component of the version of software being used. For example, if the version of software was 3.1.10, the minor version is 1.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: minorVersion

child.name: otherDesignator
child.description:
This is a string attribute, and enables the manufacturer to label this software as having some set of special restrictions (e.g., early or limited deployment, end of life, or targeted at a specific type of market.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: otherDesignator

child.name: targetPlatform
child.description:
This is an enumerated integer that defines the target platform that this Software will be deployed on. Values include: 0: Independent of Platform 1: Other 2: Network Device (specified in subclasses) 3: Server 4: Desktop Computer 5: Laptop Computer 6: PDA 7: Phone 8: Other Mobile Device

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: targetPlatform

child.name: category
child.description:
This is an enumerated integer that is used to simplify searching for related types of SoftwareElements. For example, a QoSSoftwareElement may have many different subclasses (e.g., classification, queuing, dropping, etc.). Each of these would have a similar Category that would facilitate their identification and distinction from other types (i.e., Categories) of SoftwareElements. The specific enumerated values will be defined in the next version of the DEN-ng specification.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: category

child.name: majorVersion
child.description:
This a string attribute that defines the major number component of the version of software being used. For example, if the version of software was 3.1.10, the major version is 3.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: majorVersion

child.name: logicalDevice
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation shared

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association HasSoftwareCommands

This association end is optional
child.label: logicalDevice

child.name: softwareComposite
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation shared

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association HasSoftwareComponents

This association end is optional
child.label: softwareComposite

child.name: language
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity *

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association SoftwareBuiltForLanguage

This association end is optional
child.label: language

child.name: commonPlatformEnumeration
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association SoftwareIdentifiedByCPEName

This association end is optional
child.label: commonPlatformEnumeration

child.name: operatingSystem
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity *

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association SoftwareOSInteractionDetails

This association end is optional
child.label: operatingSystem
